parameters: Hmm... I'm sure the information on this would be
valuable, but we'll have to wait for it to finish.
What happens when Wireland updates, anyway?
I'm not sure. Updates to your computer don't usually
affect your games. When games get patched, they
just adapt as if it's always been like that. Although, I
admit, I'm more familiar with consoles than computers.
Oh right, since you're not technically a computer game
character. Wait, then how did you get here?
Your router provides a link between your PS4 and your
computer. As long as both are connected to it, we can
Wait, does that mean you're trapped here with the
Given their connection to each other, it would take some
effort, but I could theoretically return. I don't want to
risk any potential errors, however, so I am going to
remain here until the issues are resolved.
Sounds like a plan. I want to keep you safe and sound
here. You can die way too many ways in your game;
I don't want to add to your discomfort.
I believe your friend Billy explained that we don't have
pain receptors in our own games.
Actually, I read it in the Wirish lawbook last time I was
here. I'm surprised how much I remember it... then
again, I don't usually download books to my brain, so...
That is a lot of information; if you need to clear your
head, it can be deleted if necessary.
No, don't delete it. It's definitely useful information here!
I concur. But we should continue looking around.
Still updating. This could take all day.
Was that a hyperbole? It seems the updates are nearly
Seems like the computer is finished updating. I'll attempt
It appears that whoever owned this computer installed
I thought you were all code here. Wouldn't that make you
That is true, however my game granted specific abilities
unavailable to the average Wirish population. Many have
installed basic measures to prevent androids from using
this ability to hack into their private data.
Ah okay, that makes sense. But how do we get in?
Many have installed simple puzzles. Since these require
physical presence with the computer, this would deter
I see. So I guess I press enter to continue.
This is definitely important, but it's a normal laptop.
There's a weird red glowing thing in the corner. Kinda
seems like more of an Anti thing than an old laptop.

Neither can I; whoever used this board last seems to
have done an excellent job of wiping it clean.
I guess we're not going to find any clues here, then.

I don't know. But that is a good question.

It looks like an old arcade machine. Maybe a broken

Do you think there could be a clue in the water cooler?
Unless the culprit is hiding in there or decided to stash
some of the evidence inside it, the chances of that
are highly unlikely. There doesn't appear to be any
tampering with the cooler itself, or the water jug.
Well, aside from getting a drink myself, I don't think we
need to hang around this for much longer.
It's just as well. I'm not detecting anything of note
through the slots on the doors, so this seems like it would
be nothing more than a dead end.
Ah, okay. We should probably move on, then.

No. It appears that this computer hasn't been used in
